column2: Which expression gives the 95 % confidence interval for the difference of two population proportions (p₁ − p₂)?
A confidence interval that *includes zero* proves there is no difference between the two population proportions.

column5: Correct – it only shows insufficient evidence.

column2: Select the correct standard‑error formula under H₀: p₁ = p₂.
What does the *p‑value* represent in this test?

column3: Probability of observed (or more extreme) data assuming H₀ is true

column2: Match each term with its correct definition.
Put the steps for building a confidence interval in order.
Multiply SE by z* to get the margin of error
